page.title: 16HUNWICK VILLAGE FETE 1985
page.content: All the people in fancy dress waited at The Wheatsheaf Inn for the floats.The procession was led by a brass band. There were lots of floats & people made a street collection.The procession toured Hunwick & ended up at the Community Centre where the fancy dress competition was judged.Someone dressed as a parrot won the Â£5 first prize,a Bertie Basset licquorice Allsort was 2nd & a Plastic Man 3rd.There were refreshments & a big inflatable bouncer, which proved very popular.A badge maker would make you a badge to your own design & there were also 'Find the Treasure' & dinosaur hoop-la games.Some girls tried to guess the name of a doll to win it,& for the adults there was a raffle.Everyone thoroughly enjoyed this sunny day & lots of money was made for the Centre.
